description: [Ghanaian Times] President Nana Addo Dankwa Akufo-Addo has called on his colleague leaders to intensify their efforts in the implementation of the findings of the Mbeki Commission on illicit financial flows.
title: Africa: Let's Implement Mbeki Commission Findings On Illicit Financial Flows - President Akufo-Addo

description: [RFI] Malian music star Toumani Diabate passed away after a short illness, his family announced over the weekend. Music lovers across the planet paid tribute to a master instrumentalist who helped share Mali's rich traditions with the world.
title: Africa: World Musicians Mourn the Loss of Mali's 'King of Kora' Toumani Diabate

description: [allAfrica] Munich, Germany -- Men are far more likely to die from an HIV-related illness than women, even though women are becoming infected with HIV at a much faster rate.
title: Africa: Traditional Masculinity Ideology Putting Men's Health at Risk Over HIV Tests, Treatment

description: [Nyasa Times] Scientists are set to reveal details about the "next Berlin Patient", now recognised as the world's seventh person cured of HIV following a stem cell transplant.
title: Africa: Is HIV/Aids Finally Ending? World's Seventh Person Cured From the Pandemic

description: [Cosafa] The Confederation of African Football has recently launched a newsletter for Member Associations detailing the work that has been carried out within the organisation and the six zones.
title: Africa: First Edition of CAF's New Member Association Newsletter

description: [Algerie Presse Service] Accra (Ghana) -- The President of the Republic, Abdelmadjid Tebboune, reiterated on Sunday Algeria's resolve, in its capacity as a non-permanent member of the UN Security Council, to defend the interests of the African continent, make its voice heard and marshal support for the joint efforts of member countries so as to enable the continent to fully contribute to peace and security in Africa as per the UN Charter, pending the correction of the injustice done to Africa regarding its representativeness in the Security
title: Africa: President Tebboune Affirms Algeria's Resolve to Defend Interests of Africa in Security Council

description: [Egypt Online] Foreign Minister Badr Abdelatty discussed in Accra on Sunday 21/7/2024 the latest developments of the Grand Ethiopian Renaissance Dam (GERD) and the situation in Sudan and the Red Sea with Bankole Adeoye, Commissioner for Political Affairs, Peace, and Security in the African Union.
title: Africa: FM Abdelatty Discusses GERD, Sudan, Red Sea Security With AU Commission Adeoye

description: [Nile Post] Only 9 percent of all plastic that has ever been produced has been recycled
title: Africa: Plastic Pollution, Africa's Biggest Environmental Nightmare

description: [Capital FM] Accra, Ghana, July 20 - In a groundbreaking move to drive innovation and entrepreneurship across Africa, the African Union (AU) and its partners, including Google and Africa Practice, have launched the AU Startup Policy Framework and Model Law.
title: Africa: African Union Launches Startup Policy Framework to Drive Innovation Across Africa

description: [Ayin English] Anger, anxiety, and betrayal are how one can describe the mood among South Sudanese following the growing xenophobic attacks and arrests in Sudan as the army-controlled areas continue to deport South Sudanese nationals.
title: Africa: Anger As Xenophobic Waves Against South Sudanese Sweep Sudan

description: [Daily Maverick] I've spent a lot of time in introspection, almost a full minute, reflecting and asking myself the tough questions: am I an Ass-man or Sass-man?
title: Africa: The America S*** Show Vs the South Africa S*** Show

description: [Daily Maverick] Joe Biden's withdrawal from the US presidential race on Sunday ended a weeks-long agonising struggle by Democrats to convince him to take one for the team after his disastrous debate performance against Donald Trump on 27 June.
title: Africa: Kamala vs Very, Very Old Trump - With Biden Gone, It Is Now a Real Race

description: [Reporter] Each time the African Union (AU) nears election season, the member countries of the region whose turn it is to fill the organization's most influential seats enter into a kind of tug-of-war for the nomination of their preferred candidates.
title: Africa: AU Elections - Will It Change Anything?

description: [IFJ] During the anti-government protests in Nakuru, journalist Catherine Kariuki was shot three times by police in what appears to be a targeted attack. Meanwhile, veteran journalist Macharia Gaitho was abducted and later released with an absurd explanation that it was a case of 'mistaken identity'.
title: Africa: Kenya - FAJ Strongly Condemns Assaults On Kenyan Journalists, Calls for Immediate Action

description: [allAfrica] Munich, Germany -- Double the stigma, double the challenge
title: Africa: Why People with Disabilities Face an Uphill Battle with HIV

description: [allAfrica] Munich, Germany -- More and more older people are living with HIV and AIDS.
title: Africa: Why HIV Risks Are Rising in Older Adults
